job description:
The Associate Scientist will:
  • Perform a leadership role in qualitative and quantitative chemical analyses/experiments for Analytical Development laboratory
  • Perform the method validation/transfer/verification testing for Analytical Development laboratory
  • Perform basic pre-formulation study for various dosage forms
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
  • Performs analytical testing of raw materials, in-process control materials, stability samples, and finished product using different analytical techniques
  • Performs analytical testing for method development
  • Performs analytical testing for method validation/transfer/verification as per the guidance provided in the relevant protocol
  • Expected to utilize established scientific techniques to compile and analyze data
  • Expected to utilize instrumental testing (UPLC, HPLC, GC, Dissolution, Auto titrate etc.) for sample analysis
  • Performs out of specification investigation testing and writing of investigation reports
  • Write technical papers and reports; prepare standard and specifications for processes, facilities, products or tests
  • Track and review the project progress
  • Perform and evaluate study for pre- formulation of solids, solutions, suspensions, gels, ointments, creams, suppositories and inhalers dosage forms
  • Support IND, NDA, ANDA filing documents
  • Ensure good relations and communications with all members of the team; respond professionally and in a timely fashion to internal and external customers
  • Ability to handle hazardous waste, and lead safety programs for the laboratory
  • Thorough knowledge for various laboratory software usages
  • Other duties as assigned
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS
  • Analytical skills and knowledge of scientific protocols and complex scientific principles necessary to perform complex experiments and research on chemicals and medicines
  • Problem Solving - Ability to find a solution for or to deal proactively with work-related problems; ability to look beyond the standard solutions
  • Research Skills - In-depth knowledge and expertise in developing new analytical method.
  • Ability to design and conduct a systematic, objective, and critical investigation
  • Advanced computer skills; ability to develop conclusions based on information from multiple sources
  • Must wear personal protective equipment at times
  • Must be able to remain sedentary for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to move about the facility at times.
EDUCATION

A Bachelor's Degree in Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Science or a related Science field

A Master's Degree in Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Science or a related Science field

EXPERIENCE:

3 to 5 - Years working in pharmaceutical environment
